In fact, spending too much time concentrating on current events can actually be harmful in itself, since it would distract from other pursuits.  Getting too bogged down in the minutiae of up-to-the-minute events can also lead to a poor understanding of the events themselves, since one will not be able to step back and see the history.  One would not be seeing the forest because the trees are in the way, as the old saying goes.

My opinion of the news media is not strictly positive, though.  Media outlets, at best, chase ratings or (in the case of public broadcasting) donations from members, and this can lead them to focus on eye-catching reporting at the expense of important reporting.  Very few news outlets spend much time on budgetary concerns in government, or distant ethnic tensions, because readers are not interested, but if this information was pushed to the forefront, it could be beneficial to everyone.
